titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert Charles Mardian papers, 1957-1995
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca J. Mead; machine-readable finding aid created by James Lake

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-14T11:56-0800

change.item: February 13, 2018: Added links to materials from the 2018 release of declassified records subseries that are available on digitalcollections.hoover.org. -Sally DeBauche <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120730" era="ce">July 30, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Robert C. Mardian papers)//EN" "reg_279.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item></change>

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, proposals, minutes, testimony, legal documents, printed matter, and audiovisual material relating to education policy during the presidential administration of Richard M. Nixon, school desegregation, surveillance of radical movements, administration of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and the Watergate affair and subsequent trials. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Charles Mardian papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Draft and final copies of speeches and articles, memoranda, clippings, and other printed material. Primarily relates to school desegregation and Nixon Administration policies. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Department of Health, Education, and Welfare,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeches, memoranda, reports, clippings, correspondence, notes, printed articles, legal documents, newsletters, statutes and regulations, school desegregation plans, legislative proposals, and miscellany. Primarily relates to school desegregation. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: White House communications. Correspondence, memoranda, legal documents, speech transcript, and clippings,
Austin Geriatrics. Material relating to a disputed transfer of government property
Notes. Also includes draft and final copies of a speech, and memoranda
Robert Finch testimony relating to the Emergency School Aid Act of 1970
Jerris Leonard, Select Committee on Equal Educational Opportunity,
Admiral Hyman Rickover, House Committee on Education and Labor,
Legislative histories of Titles IV and VI
Title VI. Relates to non-discrimination in federally-asisted programs, primarily school desegregation
Federal Employees for a Democratic Society
General. AFDC program, Medicaid, and other miscellany
Rosado v. Wyman. Relates to the welfare program in New York
Dandridge v. Williams. Relates to the welfare program in Maryland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, statements (including Richard Nixon), press releases, clippings, correspondence, agenda and minutes, legislative proposals, and a petition. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Includes material relating to consultants, a conference in Atlanta, and a videotape production
General. Includes meetings with concerned mothers, Mississippi officials, and state governors
Frederick Mosteller and Daniel P. Moynihan (eds.), "On Equality of Educational Opportunity"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, affidavits, briefs and other legal documents, transcripts, memoranda, reports, correspondence, newsletters, pamphlets, and clippings. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Camden, N.J. Clippings relating to draft board arrests
Sullivan, William. Correspondence and a serial issue,
Kleindienst, Richard G. Relates to his nomination for Attorney General
Hearings. Primarily relates to the ITT investigation; includes notes, memoranda, statements, and correspondence
Korean-American relations. Primarily memoranda relating to investigations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents, correspondence, transcripts, interviews, press releases, wire reports and press summaries, bulletins, serial issues, clippings, notes, and printed material. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Serial issues relating to the Nixon administration,
General. Correspondence, press releases, memoranda, report, and printed material
Clippings and press material. Includes serial issues, wire reports, and press summaries
Preparatory material. Correspondence, notes, clippings, memoranda, and legal documents
Ginsburg, Feldman, and Press Legal Files,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents, reports, correspondence, hearing and testimony transcripts, printed material, memoranda, statements, notes, and miscellany. The material relates to the trial of Mitchell, et al., for Watergate offenses, the appeal of Mardian's conviction, and a subsequent claim by him against the 1972 campaign liquidation trust. Arranged by case in the order established by the law firm representing Robert Mardian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, notes, legal documents, speeches, printed material and miscellany. Primarily relates to Watergate-related trials and Justice Department files.

did.unittitle: Seven video cassettes of Robert Mardian's testimony before the Senate Watergate Committee,
